text: The Bruche is a river in Alsace, in north-eastern France. It is a left-side tributary of the Ill river, and part of the basin of the Rhine river. ==Geography== The Bruche river has a length of , and a drainage basin with an area of . ===Course=== The Bruche starts in the Vosges mountains, at the western foot of the Climont mountain, in the commune of Urbeis, (Bas-Rhin department), at an altitude of about . From here, the Bruche flows first to the north and then turns to the northeast. The Bruche river flows within the Grand Est region, the Bas-Rhin department and 38 communes. Finally, the Bruche river flows into the Ill river in the city of Strasbourg, southwest of the historic centre. ==Main tributaries== The main tributaries of the Bruche river are the Magel, a right tributary long, and the Mossig, a left tributary long. == Hydrology == Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is at Holtzheim in the Bas- Rhin department, for the period 1965 - 2017.
